snippet: Papelbon, Philadelphia’s closer, was suspended for seven games and fined by Major League Baseball for making a lewd gesture and then bumping an umpire on Sunday.
abstract: Baseball Roundup; Philadelphia Phillies closer Jonathan Papelbon is suspended for seven games and fined by Major League Baseball for making a lewd gesture, then bumping an umpire; other MLB news noted.
lead_paragraph: Papelbon, Philadelphia’s closer, was suspended for seven games and fined by Major League Baseball for making a lewd gesture and then bumping an umpire on Sunday.

headline.main: Seven-Game Suspension for Phillies’ Jonathan Papelbon
